title: 5 Breakfast Recipes with Eggs
excerpt: If you’ve grown tired of your breakfast, then you absolutely need to try out these mouthwatering breakfast recipes with eggs.
author: Chino Valley Ranchers
content:
If you’ve grown tired of your breakfast, then you absolutely need to try out these mouthwatering breakfast recipes with eggs. 

1. Keto Sausage Breakfast Sandwich

For this creative take on a breakfast sandwich, you’ll need large eggs, heavy cream, cheddar cheese, sausage patties, avocado, salt, black pepper, butter and red pepper flakes. The sausages serve as the buns, and the eggs, cheese and avocado go in between. Whether you’re on a keto diet or not, this protein-rich breakfast sandwich will keep you full till lunchtime.

View the full Keto Sausage Breakfast Sandwich recipe.

2. Low-Carb Breakfast Enchiladas

Have a Mexican desayuno with these scrumptious low-carb breakfast enchiladas.You’ll need eggs, milk, bacon, spinach, black beans, cherry tomatoes, enchilada sauce, cheddar cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, cilantro, avocado, pico de gallo and spices. Fuel your day with protein and vitamins and feel good about eating a healthy breakfast.

View the full Low-Carb Breakfast Enchiladas recipe. 

3. Avocado Egg-in-a-Hole

This recipe takes creative cooking to a “hole” new level. You’ll slice an avocado and pour the egg into the center. Top the avocado-egg goodness with salt, pepper and cheese, cook in a skillet, and enjoy an incredibly delicious breakfast. 

View the full Avocado Egg-in-a-Hole recipe. 

4. Bacon Egg and Cheese Roll-Ups

Who says you have to wait until dinner to indulge? This bacon egg and cheese roll-up recipe is for those who don’t mind the extra protein and energy at breakfast. For this recipe you’ll need eggs, milk, chopped chives, shredded cheddar, butter and spices.

View the full Bacon Egg and Cheese Roll-Ups recipe. 

5. Cloud Eggs

Take your eggs to cloud nine with this heavenly cloud eggs recipe. You’ll need eggs (as in eight large eggs), ham, Parmesan, salt, pepper and chives. Separate the egg whites and yolks and beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold in the ham and parmesan and season with salt and pepper. Form eight mounds of egg whites on a baking sheet and indent the centers to create nests. Bake for three minutes and then add the egg yolk onto the center of each nest. Back for an additional three minutes and top with chives.

View the full Cloud Eggs recipe.
